Opener on @realmoney This Week Demonstrates My Incremental Tactical Approach in Responding to a Possible Topping in the Markets * In trading and investing, you don't have to submerge - you can take a dip incrementally * The investment mosaic is complex and ever changing - it

is also becoming less predictable (on a near term basis) because of a changing market structure that exacerbates short term moves * A regime of heightened volatility is ideal for opportunistic and unemotional traders and investors * The "Biden Bump" realmoney.thestreet.com/doug… is

likely over * I entered this week large net long in exposure and have steadily reduced by exposure to where I moved into net short exposure yesterday - as the +350 handle rise in the S&P has pulled forward the fourth quarter gains I previously expected I try to be

consistent in my market view. But that view is ever changing as the investment mosaic is both complex and dynamic - my outlook is fed by the changing input factors of both fundamentals and price. Price and fundamentals are among the core foundations of security analysis and also

at the core of what value investors Graham and Dodd called a "margin of safety." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Margin… My general view of the attractiveness of an equity that can be purchased for $6/share and is worth $10/share is far different when the same stock is trading at $11/share and

still worth $10/share. And that calculus of a "fair market value" changes, as well, with fundamentals. My intrinsic value calculus of $10/share is forever changing as the fundamentals change - but, as it is said, "beauty is in the eyes of the beholder."

The "beauty" of my calculation of value is only as good as my input that determines that value. @jimcramer @tomkeene @SquawkCNBC @cnbcfastmoney @lizclaman @FerroTV @business @realdonaldtrump @riskreversal @terranovajoe @guyadami @carlquintanilla @threadreaderapp unroll

These non factual attacks and lies are consistent with a weak member of the press, a commentaor who does little homework, is repetitive, petty and dogmatic. These characteristics are vivid every morning. So before you attack consider the facts and do your homework.

My price target when the position was put on in Dec 2018 was $3000, appreciably higher than any Street target. That was reached this year and my 3 year price target is $7000. This is one of many examples of his misrep and attacks, there are many more.

For example he has often repeated that I was short $AMZN since $1000 to current prices. I was short briefly and lost a small amt of $. But I went long $AMZN at under $1400 and its been my largest long for some time as documented on Twitter and @realmoney.
As I have tweeted, he has used his bully pulpit by delivering ad hominem attacks against me over last 5 years. Those attacks are baseless, unsupported factually and basically a bunch of lies.
